forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content: Hello, I need advice, I have a home 500GB SATA HDD (removed from the PC) and when you move it to another PC and I want it to boot Windows XP Home, is a USB connection, 2-3 seconds to load classic Windows starts, then there Not for a second blue screen and restart the pc the same thing over and over. Please advice, thank you and sorry for my English.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> Hello, I need advice, I have a home 500GB SATA HDD (removed from the PC) and when you move it to another PC and I want it to boot Windows XP Home, is a USB connection, 2-3 seconds to load classic Windows starts, then there Not for a second blue screen and restart the pc the same thing over and over. Please advice, thank you and sorry for my English.

Check the BSOD STOP ERROR, see here:  
[http://www.911cd.net...o...=24161\&st=3](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=24161&st=3 "External link")  

It is most probably a 0x0000007b.  

You need to install and make active the USB drivers.  

Most probably this is the easiest path you can take:  
[http://www.boot-land...?...ic=9830\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9830&hl= "External link")  

:wink:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content: I need to explain it inactive so much a noob I do not understand what you write here and not very good in English using Google Translate so that you do not understand, I edited the boot.ini and I go try to put away the blue screen.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I need to explain it inactive so much a noob I do not understand what you write here and not very good in English using Google Translate so that you do not understand, I edited the boot.ini and I go try to put away the blue screen.
BOOT.INI has NOTHING to do with your problem. :wink:  

The idea is to have the Blue screen **stay** so that you can read the STOP ERROR number.  

If you post in English on a Forum where English is used, you are supposed to understand English.  

We don't have a "regional" section:  
[http://www.boot-land...hp?showforum=39](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showforum=39 "External link")  
for czech, maybe you can find a friend that better understands English? :wink:  

:wink:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content:
Error code is 0x0000007B (0xBA4C7524, 0x0000034, 0x00000000, 0x00000000) now, please consult same time, what   

**Edited by Ags, 13 November 2010 - 03:55 PM.**

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Good.  
That was expected. :wink:  

Now, what you need to do is to "transform" that install into an USB bootable one.  

There are several ways, but AFAIK they are ONLY documented in English. (or pseudo-English :wink:).  

The idea is to make the USB drivers load at boot time and prevent windows from re-setting their Group and Start type.  

The program by Wimb:  
[http://www.boot-land...?...ic=9830\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9830&hl= "External link")  

should be able to do that.  

Otherwise you should try using marv's service:  
[http://www.911cd.net...o...c=22473\&hl=](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=22473&hl= "External link")  

Some details are given in this seemingly unrelated thread:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9196](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9196 "External link")  
(ONLY the information about ISB services is useful)   

It is assumed that you understand the "principles" of the findings by Dietmar Stoelting:  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=14181](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=14181 "External link")  
(check the Tutorials linked to in his signature)  

:wink:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content: I do not understand you please give a link directly to the program and how to write your own words what I do.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I do not understand you please give a link directly to the program and how to write your own words what I do.

That is the problem.  
We are talking of a very complex topic.  
You will NOT be able to do it unless you understand FULLY the basics.  

\[pseudo-czech\]  
To je ten problém.  
Mluvíme o velmi komplexní téma.  
Nebudete schopni to udělat, pokud jste plně pochopit základy.  
\[/pseudo-czech\]  

:wink:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content: so please write inactive for him to understand even the biggest idiot and put a link directly to the program not on the forum I did not withdraw anything else

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> so please write inactive for him to understand even the biggest idiot and put a link directly to the program not on the forum I did not withdraw anything else NO. It makes NO sense whatever to use a program WITHOUT knowing HOW to use it AND without knowing WHAT it does. And believe me it is DIFFICULT. Each program is however linked to in the posts I gave you.
\[pseudo-czech\] NO. Nedává to smysl, co použít program bez vědět, jak jej používat a, aniž by věděl, co program dělá. A věřte mi, je to těžké. Každý program je však spojena s do míst co jsem ti dal. \[/pseudo-czech\] :wink: Wonko P.S.: czech proverbs: [http://en.wikiquote..../Czech_proverbs](http://en.wikiquote.org/wiki/Czech_proverbs "External link") "Bez práce nejsou koláče." Translation: There are no cakes without work. English equivalent: You don't work; you don't eat. English equivalent: There's no such thing as a free lunch. "Kolik jazyků znáš, tolikrát jsi člověkem." Translation: The more languages you know, the more (times) you are human. Meaning: The more languages you know, the richer is your life. "Žádný učený z nebe nespadl." Translation: Wise men don't fall from the sky. Meaning: Knowledge doesn't come easily. English equivalent: You can't expect knowledge to hit you over the head.

forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content: Please write you how I do it again and write it in paragraphs pls give a link directly to the program I do not want to accidentally download something else.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Again NO.  

It is likely that you ruin the disk, making it not bootable.  

The only member I know that comes from the czech republic is Filip Hasa:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showuser=12670](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showuser=12670 "External link")  

You need some guidance to use those methods/programs.  

Try contacting him.  

\[pseudo-czech\]  
Opět NO.  

Je pravděpodobné, že vás zničit disk, takže není bootovací.  

Jediným členem Vím, že pochází z Česká republika je Filip Hasa:  
[http://www.boot-land...?showuser=12670](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showuser=12670 "External link")  

Musíte určité vodítko k používání těchto metod / programů.  

Zkuste kontaktovat ho.  
\[/pseudo-czech\]  

:wink:  
Wonko

forumNotes.author: Filip Hasa
forumNotes.content:

uz jsem psal post, ale ztratil se/ asi jsem ho neulozitl. promin.  

Vzhledem k tomu co potrebujes. Je potreba aby sis prosel [postup](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9830&hl= "External link") jak psal wonko.  

koukal jsi na nej?

forumNotes.author: Filip Hasa
forumNotes.content:
Dle meho potrebujes toto:
> 4. Universal Image Create and Restore - Details > > - IMG_XP_Restore.exe for Restore on USB drive takes care of: > USB Services get "Group"="Boot Bus Extender" and Start=0 to prevent BSOD 7B > UsbBootWatcher.exe and UsbBootWatcher.conf are copied to USB-HDD\\WINDOWS\\system32 directory. > Thanks to marv and cdob for describing effect of Driver Group and Start value to prevent BSOD 7B in booting XP from USB. > [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=22473](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=22473 "External link")

forumNotes.author: Ags
forumNotes.content: no ja neumim moc dobre anglicky takže mi vysvětli pls česky jak mam co udělat

forumNotes.author: Filip Hasa
forumNotes.content:
> no ja neumim moc dobre anglicky takže mi vysvětli pls česky jak mam co udělat

to mi je lito, ale prekladat ti to nebudu, nemam tolik volneho casu abych si mohl dovolit ti to prelozit a predpokladam ze mi za to nehodlas platit abych si ho nasel ![:hi:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/hi.gif) kdybys mel sedmicky, muzem to nejak zacit resit, ted se snazim nabootovat 2008 na vmware (instalace na HW) ale pada mi to do stejne smrti ![:hi:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/hi.gif)  

myslim ze je nevyssi cas se pustit do anglictiny ci se to zkusit na ceskem foru  

v odkazu mas podrobny postup, takze co vic dodat  

uz se dostavas vice do vnitrku systemu, takze te anglictina stejne ceka  

sorry
